intro: Oliganthes karstenii, commonly known as the Karsten's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs. Oliganthes karstenii is known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of many plants in its family.
